handist.collections.dist

Interface MoveManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CollectiveMoveManager, OneSidedMoveManager

    public interface MoveManager
    MoveManager is an entity which handles the transfer or distributed collections entries from one distributed collection to another. They are used to guarantee that data transfers occur in a single "transaction". An implementation of this interface needs to be given as parameter to the methods defined in KeyRelocatable and RangeRelocatable.

    MoveManager typically accumulate the serializers and deserializers used to make the transfer until a trigger method specific to the implementation is called. Only when this specific trigger is called that the actual removal of instances from distributed collections and their serialization will occur.

    Author:
    Patrick Finnerty

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void request(apgas.Place dest, Serializer serialize, DeSerializer deserialize)
      Submits a pair of serializer and deserializer to the move manager along with the place to which the entries handled by this pair of serializer/deserializer should be transferred to

    • Method Detail

      • request

        void request(apgas.Place dest,
             Serializer serialize,
             DeSerializer deserialize)
        Submits a pair of serializer and deserializer to the move manager along with the place to which the entries handled by this pair of serializer/deserializer should be transferred to
        Parameters:
        dest - place to which objects should be transferred
        serialize - serializer which will transform some objects into a byte array
        deserialize - complement to the serializer which will transform a byte array back into the original objects
